alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 14 at 2:16PM MST until March 16 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected, beginning Wednesday evening lasting into Thursday morning. * WHERE...A portion of west central Arizona, including the following county, Yavapai. This is for Wet Beaver Creek, including the Rimrock and Lake Montezuma areas. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of Wet Beaver Creek will occur Wednesday evening lasting through Thursday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 211 PM MST, gauge reports indicated heavy rain and snowmelt will lead to moderate flooding. - Flooding will occur along the Wet Beaver Creek. The flood crest is expected to reach the Wet Beaver Creek stream gage upstream of Rimrock by 1132 PM Wednesday night. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rimrock, Montezuma Well, Lake Montezuma, Mcguireville, Montezuma Castle National Monument, Wet Beaver Creek Campground and V Bar V Visitors Center. - This includes the following swimming holes... Wet Beaver Creek Day Use Area and Bell Crossing "The Crack". - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report any flooding to local law enforcement and the NWS Flagstaff when you can do so safely.
